title: Needle & Herb Acupuncture 30 Allens Creek Road, Rochester, NY, USA
description: Needle & Herb Acupuncture, specializing in back pain, neck pain and migraines.
cleaned_text: Meet Christine Christine DeLozier is a licensed acupuncturist and author. She is kind, knowledgable, and cares about her patients. Christine has offered expert commentary for [The Huffington Post](https://www.huffpost.com/entry/valentines-day-foods-to-avoid_l_601875bdc5b6aa4bad36a80a), Marie Claire and [Good [Mel Magazine](https://melmagazine.com/en-us/story/foods-for-better-sex), and The [Toronto Sun](https://torontosun.com/life/food/making-reservations-for-romance-with-a-side-of-steamy-sex). Christine studied biology and psychology at the University of Rochester, where she also trained to be a research scientist. She holds Master's degrees in Acupuncture, Traditional Chinese Medicine, and Counseling. She also studied traditional Chinese dietary therapy and earned a certificate in holistic nutrition. My Specializations Acupuncture is a system of medicine used to treat various physical, mental, and emotional conditions and to alleviate pain. It has been proven in research to improve musculoskeletal conditions of all kinds, and Christine specializes in the following: What Patients Say "I thought it was just a bunch of voodoo, but it really helped my neck and back pain tremendously!" -Carleen -Google Review "The healer you have been looking for is your own courage to know and love yourself
